name: Create volumes on lxc-Host
description:
Creates a host-specific volumes directory that is not bound to any container.

The directory structure is: <mountpoint>/volumes/<hostname>

This directory can be used for Docker volumes or other host-specific data that needs to persist independently of container bind mounts.

This template can be called independently and is safe to call multiple times (idempotent).

parameters.name: Mount point base path
parameters.description: Base mount point path. The volumes directory will be created at <mountpoint>/volumes/<hostname>.

parameters.name: Container hostname
parameters.description: Hostname of the container. Used to create a unique volumes directory per container.

parameters.name: UID for volumes directory
parameters.description: Optional: UID to set for the volumes directory. If not provided, default permissions will be used.

parameters.name: GID for volumes directory
parameters.description: Optional: GID to set for the volumes directory. If not provided, default permissions will be used.

commands.description: Executes the script to create the volumes directory on the host.
